Package com.example.android.camera2video

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Observable
    The interface that is required for any class that want to use this to send network signals to the classes that need it.
    Observer
    Is paired with the Observable class.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AutoFitTextureView
    A TextureView that can be adjusted to a specified aspect ratio.
    Camera2VideoFragment
    I pulled this straight from Google's examples and made modifications of my own in order to tailor it for our app.
    Camera2VideoFragment.CompareSizesByArea
    Compares two Sizes based on their areas.
    Camera2VideoFragment.ConfirmationDialog  
    Camera2VideoFragment.ErrorDialog  
    CameraActivity
    I pulled this code from the Google examples.
    ConnectActivity
    This class takes in the connection information such as the IP address, port number, username and password for the laptop so that it can create a connection to the laptop and transfer to the camera portion of this application.
    FTPConn
    This class provides all of the functions necessary for the application to transfer the recorded video file back to the laptop over an SFTP connection.
    FTPConnTest  
    FTPUpload
    This class is a class to house the function for transferring the video file to the laptop.
    MyProgressMonitor
    This class was created so that we could easily monitor when the SFTP file transfer started and finished.
    NetConn
    This class will allow for a single location for all network messages to flow through.
    NetConnTest  
    ReadLoop
    This class is a listener loop that is spawned as a separate thread from the NetConn class.
    ReadLoopTest  
    TestObserver
    Class to help us test the Readloop class and the network messages it may be recieving.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Signal
    Enumeration for different signals that can be handled by this app.
